page.title: 16SWINDON VILLAGE TROUGH
page.content: In{Swindon Village }there is a horse trough of polished red marble.Nowadays it is used for growing flowers to make the Village look pretty. People used to put water in it and the horses used to drink out of it.The {Trough}used to be situated outside the old Cross Hands Pub,Tewkesbury Road. The old pub was pulled down and the new Cross Hands Pub was built,so it was decided to move the{Trough}to outside Swindon Village Hall. They considered it was a better site. The writing on it says, "Presented by Mrs.Waddington and the Misses Emily and Blanche Belcher in memory of their father and mother Mr.and Mrs. Belcher of Swindon Hall,1909. Metropolitan Drinking Fountain and Cattle Trough Association". We had Belchers at Elmfield Junior School.
